project.teaser: CLIMABOROUGH is an Innovation project designed to field test the ClimHub, Climate Sandbox and Climate Service concepts within 12 European Cities engaged in their ecological and digital transition. The project aims to enhance traditional urban and spatial planning approaches...
project.objective: CLIMABOROUGH is an Innovation project designed to field test the ClimHub, Climate Sandbox and Climate Service concepts within 12 European Cities engaged in their ecological and digital transition. The project aims to enhance traditional urban and spatial planning approaches through data and knowledge based decision making (including a possible new role for GIS - Geographic Information Systems), including climate services co-production for transitions, cross-city and cross-country pilot co-creation as well as the tactical use of public procurement of innovative solutions. The goal is not just to enhance an open set of tools leveraging climate transition in cities, but also to boost the exchange of experimental good practices, experiences and lessons learnt in this field, to help cities meet climate neutrality by 2050. This will be achieved by the following expected results: (A) building ClimHubs of Cities and solution providers to work on experimentations in real conditions, (B) harnessing the collective intelligence of local stakeholders for collaborative solution development, (C) defining Climate Services as a model strategy to use data and visualisation tools for climate transition, (D) field testing the Climate Sandbox concept as a way to prioritise and facilitate transformation of successfully deployed prototypes into established solutions for climate adaptation and mitigation in cities, and (E) monitoring and assessing the progress in achieving those goals and in implementing a climate neutrality planning scheme. Based on the lessons learnt and successful concept of the H2020 Designscapes CSA, CLIMABOROUGH has the ambition to bridge the gap between design and implementation of urban innovations, particularly in the domain of climate change adaptation and mitigation.
project.title: Building Green and Climate Neutral City-Hubs
project.keywords: Climhubs, Climate Sandbox, Climate Services, Innovative Public Procurement

webItem.title: Living with climate change
webItem.alternativeText: The EU Mission on Adaptation to Climate Change is supporting at least 150 European regions in becoming climate-resilient by 2030. The infographic illustrates several examples. In Zagreb, Croatia, 1500 new trees alleviate extreme heat on city streets. In the Canary Islands, better aquifer measurements help islanders manage water resources. In the Berlin-Brandenburg region, authorities will balance increased water demand with an expected 40 % drop in surface water. In the Netherlands, floating houses are one way flood risk is being integrated into urban planning. A pilot in Croatia and Slovakia uses mesh networks and autonomous vehicles to combat wildfires.

webItem.title: Metro metrics
webItem.alternativeText: Cities are home to 75% of EU citizens and generate 70% of CO2 emissions. Transitioning to smart and carbon-neutral cities will mean deploying a range of technologies, strategies and governance tools. The infographic presents the share of urban greenhouse gas emissions by sector: Stationary energy 55%, Transport 26.3%, Waste and wastewater treatment 3.1%, Industrial processes and products use 12.5%, Agriculture, forestry and other land use 2.1%, Other 1%. Source: Self reported data from 105 Mission Cities. Data was not externally verified and not all cities presented comprehensive data on emissions.

category.title: Projects Information Pack
category.description: Article: Selections of projects in their early stages focusing on a specific research theme

article.teaser: In the face of unprecedented challenges posed by climate change, the European Union has embarked on an ambitious journey towards a sustainable and resilient future. The EU Missions on Adaptation to Climate Change and on Climate-Neutral and Smart Cities under Horizon Europe, the EU’s key funding programme for research and innovation, represent significant pillars in this transformative endeavour. This brochure showcases 14 European-funded Mission projects that show the collaborative spirit, innovation and commitment required to address the pressing issues of climate change.

result.title: Monitoring report 1
result.description: Summary of the progress and advancements of CLIMABOROUGH identified impacts, classified on five specific sustainability pillars: Environment, Economy, Society, Institution, Policies. This is related to T1.5.

result.title: Reference Architecture for CLIMABOROUGH Platform
result.description: This deliverable will define the architecture, the building blocks and the standards, as well as the requirements, the blockers, the plans, the critical gaps etc.of the CLIMABOROUGH platform. It is related to T2.1.

result.title: Baseline analyses
result.description: This deliverable reports a1 baseline analysis for each of the pilot cities developing the Climate Sandbox concept. It is related to T5.1.

result.title: Monitoring tool of CLIMABOROUGH project
result.description: The Monitoring Tool has the scope to define a common framework of KPIs to measure the project impacts and to guide urban planning strategies towards Climate Neutrality. This is related to T1.1, T1.2 and T1.3.

result.title: Challenge Solutions 1
result.description: This deliverable defines more specific detail on the practical solutions that have been co-created; transferred from leader to follower; and successfully (or not) moved to the market

result.title: Data Management Plan 1
result.description: Deliverable issued in three versions during the project’s lifetime, complying with both Open Access and GDPR provisions.

result.title: Inception Report
result.description: The inception report will report the pilot operation plans of CLIMABOROUGH Cities. This is a living document related to T3.2 and T3.3 and it will be conducted in relation with WP2 and WP5. This document will report the follower cities pilot operations plan from M24.

result.title: Open Market Consultation Documentation 1
result.description: This document reports the framework and plan the activities associated with the launch of the open market consultations. It is the output of T4.1.

result.title: Technical Report on Platform Development and Deployment
result.description: This deliverable will report the preparation of the platform integration plan using input from WP32 about the requirements. It is related to T2.2.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - CLIMABOROUGH (Building Green and Climate Neutral City-Hubs)
result.teaser: The project works to address the many bottlenecks in the transition from prototyping to testing of innovation and from successful testing to market deployment.In CLIMABOROUGH, we define and promise to test three innovative concepts:- The “Climate Sandbox”, facilitating...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Innovation Assessment Report
result.description: The deliverable will identify current state, challenges, priorities, blockers, emerging plans, critical gaps etc. It is related to T3.1.

result.title: Data Management Plan 2
result.description: This deliverable is the second version of the three versions issued during the project’s lifetime, complying with both Open Access and GDPR provisions.

result.title: Dissemination and communication plan
result.description: This document is released at early project stage including the definition of the dissemination and communication infrastructure of the project (T6.1 and T6.2).

result.title: Gender requirements for public procurement, evaluation and urban executive plans
result.description: This document will report the gender requirements for the public procurement activities, evaluation and for the elaboration of the Urban executive plans.

result.title: List of Awarded Proposals 1
result.description: This document reports the awarded proposals of the first cycle of public procurement (leader cities). It is the output of T4.4 with the contents described therein. (Leader: ANCI; R, PU, M18, M40)

result.title: Innovative Procurement Tender Documentation 1
result.description: This document reports the legal documentation required for the 8 innovative procurement calls. It is the output of T4.2 with the contents described therein.

category.title: geographic information systems
category.displayCode: /natural sciences/earth and related environmental sciences/physical geography/cartography/geographic information systems

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
